<Text: A Cultural Property (文化財 , bunkazai ) is administered by the Japanese government's Agency for Cultural Affairs, and includes tangible properties (structures and works of art or craft); intangible properties (performing arts and craft techniques); folk properties both tangible and intangible; monuments historic, scenic and natural; cultural landscapes; and groups of traditional buildings.>
Triplets:<A Cultural Property
Japanese government's Agency for Cultural Affairs
1:
--------------------
<Text: Cultural Property (Japan):  Buried properties and conservation techniques are also protected.>
Triplets:<Cultural Property
2:
--------------------
Text: Cultural Property (Japan):  Together these cultural properties are to be preserved and utilized as the heritage of the Japanese people.
Triplets:<Cultural Property (Japan)
